duties_responsibilities.duty: Performs inspections on assigned vehicles according to M.A.P. Guidelines and reports findings to service management
Explains mechanical diagnoses and needed repairs to non-mechanical individuals, including teammates and supervisors
Performs tasks in areas such as brakes, electrical, engine performance, heating/air conditioning, suspension/steering, transmissions, and manual drivetrains and axles
Ensures service area mechanical repair problems are communicated to store management
Demonstrates proficiency in the application of BSRO methods, standards, and procedures
Maintains ASE certification and BSRO certifications according to company standards
Maintains service center standards of cleanliness, orderliness, and appearance of equipment and space
Complies with company safety policy and federal/state OSHA safety requirements
Provides on-the-job training for new team members and apprentices
Performs physical tasks related to tire service, oil changes, alignments, fluid services, brake services, and other automotive repair services

education_certification.credential: Minimum 2 years of automotive repair experience, completion of Vocational-Technical School program in a related field, or demonstrated skills via third party certificates/assessment
ASE certification in at least one of A1-A8 is preferred
